MP Pappu Yadav demanded severe punishment, while MLA I P Gupta offered a Rs 10 lakh reward for his capture.]]></description><link><![CDATA[https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/patna/row-over-remark-on-bihar-women-intensifies/articleshow/126326860.cms]]></link><guid><![CDATA[https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/patna/row-over-remark-on-bihar-women-intensifies/articleshow/126326860.cms]]></guid><pubDate>Sun, 04 Jan 2026 00:09:15 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>MANOJ CHAURASIA</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="973478" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-126330792,imgsize-973478.cms"/></item><item><title><![CDATA[US strikes in Venezuela: Did Trump have authority to capture Maduro? What the law says]]></title><description><![CDATA[US forces conducted a large-scale strike in Venezuela, capturing President Nicolás Maduro and his wife, Cilia Flores, following pre-dawn attacks on Caracas. Maduro faces terrorism and drug charges in New York, with the US accusing him of leading a narco-terrorist organization. The operation's legality is debated, with experts citing potential violations of international law.]]></description><link><![CDATA[https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/us-strikes-in-venezuela-did-trump-have-authority-to-capture-maduro-what-the-law-says/articleshow/126330958.cms]]></link><guid><![CDATA[https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/world/us/us-strikes-in-venezuela-did-trump-have-authority-to-capture-maduro-what-the-law-says/articleshow/126330958.cms]]></guid><pubDate>Sun, 04 Jan 2026 10:35:08 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>TOI WORLD DESK</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="49704" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-126331086,imgsize-49704.cms"/></item><item><title><![CDATA[Jay Bhanushali, Mahhi Vij part ways after 14 years of marriage; announce separation]]></title><description><![CDATA[Television actors Jay Bhanushali and Mahhi Vij have confirmed their separation after 14 years of marriage. The couple announced their decision to part ways amicably, emphasizing their commitment to their children, Tara, Khushi, and Rajveer. They stated their intention to remain supportive friends, prioritizing peace and respect.]]></description><link><![CDATA[https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tv/news/hindi/jay-bhanushali-and-mahhi-vij-end-their-14-year-marriage-announce-separation-say-there-is-no-villain-in-this-story-and-no-negativity-attached/articleshow/126332628.cms]]></link><guid><![CDATA[https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/tv/news/hindi/jay-bhanushali-and-mahhi-vij-end-their-14-year-marriage-announce-separation-say-there-is-no-villain-in-this-story-and-no-negativity-attached/articleshow/126332628.cms]]></guid><pubDate>Sun, 04 Jan 2026 13:42:12 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>etimes.in</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="28354" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-126332654,imgsize-28354.cms"/></item><item><title><![CDATA[‘Why only Mahayuti?’: Oppn slams 68 unopposed Maha civic wins; alleges bribery, threats]]></title><description><![CDATA[A significant number of Mahayuti candidates secured unopposed victories in municipal polls, with the BJP leading the count. Opposition leaders decried the situation, alleging widespread use of money and threats to force withdrawals, and accused the state election commission of bias. Allegations of bribery and undue influence were prominent.]]></description><link><![CDATA[https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/why-only-mahayuti-candidates-opposition-cries-foul-over-68-unopposed-wins-in-maharashtra-civic-polls-alleges-rs-5-cr-bribes-threats/articleshow/126330289.cms]]></link><guid><![CDATA[https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/mumbai/why-only-mahayuti-candidates-opposition-cries-foul-over-68-unopposed-wins-in-maharashtra-civic-polls-alleges-rs-5-cr-bribes-threats/articleshow/126330289.cms]]></guid><pubDate>Sun, 04 Jan 2026 07:34:24 +0530</pubDate><dc:creator>PRIYANKA KAKODKAR, PRADEEP GUPTA, MANOJ BADGERI</dc:creator><enclosure type="image/jpeg" length="2148452" url="https://static.toiimg.com/photo/msid-126330336,imgsize-2148452.cms"/></item></channel></rss>

    <item>
      <title><![CDATA[EV slowdown globally, but India’s Kazam nears ₹100-crore run rate as tier-3 cities power growth]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/business/startup/ev-charging-startup-kazam-revenue-expansion-plan-19813353.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[Kazam’s growth story underscores how India’s EV momentum is shifting away from metros, with tier-3 cities and three-wheeler electrification driving demand for charging infrastructure. As the startup moves closer to a ₹100-crore revenue run rate, it is also expanding beyond charging hardware into energy intelligence and peer-to-peer power trading, while keeping capital efficiency and profitability at the core of its strategy.]]></description>

      <title><![CDATA[Max Estates sees big opportunity in Delhi NCR, rules out other markets]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/business/companies/max-estates-stay-focused-on-delhi-ncr-cites-large-market-opportunity-gurugram-alpha-article-19812489.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[Max Estates CFO Nitin Kansal said the company is on track to achieve ₹6,000–6,500 crore in sales bookings, with most launches planned for the second half of the year. He said NCR markets are seeing a shift from rapid price increases to steady growth, with Noida and Gurugram showing different demand trends.     <item>
      <title><![CDATA[Ageing with Dignity: The Antara Senior Care Story ]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/access/watchlist/business/ageing-with-dignity-the-antara-senior-care-story-19812512.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[India is ageing fast. Seniors already account for 11% of the population. By 2050, that share will double to 21% - meaning one in every five Indians will be aged above 60. With longer lifespans, shrinking family units and dual-income households, one truth is clear: More seniors will age alone and with more complex care needs than ever before. On Young Turks Reloaded, Shereen Bhan speaks with Tara Singh Vachani, Executive Chairperson of Antara Senior Care, a company that's determined to reshape how India thinks about ageing and elder care.She recalls Antara’s early years, battling stigma and misconception, when senior care facilities were perceived as aid to abandonment. But now, the mindset has evolved, especially after the pandemic. “People have started believing in wellness a lot more. They have understood that, as they get older, they need an ecosystem to support them,” Tara shares. Today, 60-year-olds are redefining retirement. It’s no longer just about grandchildren and slowing down. They are embracing self-care without guilt - a shift also powered by India’s economic prosperity, which allows seniors to prioritise their own needs while fulfilling obligations to their families. And while the world is busy trying to ‘hack longevity’, Tara believes the focus must be on living well. As she puts it, Antara’s mission is 'to make the years that you are alive as joyful, as healthy, and as happy as possible'.India is ageing fast. Seniors already account for 11% of the population. By 2050, that share will double to 21% - meaning one in every five Indians will be aged above 60. With longer lifespans, shrinking family units and dual-income households, one truth is clear: More seniors will age alone and with more complex care needs than ever before. On Young Turks Reloaded, Shereen Bhan speaks with Tara Singh Vachani, Executive Chairperson of Antara Senior Care, a company that's determined to reshape how India thinks about ageing and elder care.She recalls Antara’s early years, battling stigma and misconception, when senior care facilities were perceived as aid to abandonment. But now, the mindset has evolved, especially after the pandemic. “People have started believing in wellness a lot more. They have understood that, as they get older, they need an ecosystem to support them,” Tara shares. Today, 60-year-olds are redefining retirement. It’s no longer just about grandchildren and slowing down. They are embracing self-care without guilt - a shift also powered by India’s economic prosperity, which allows seniors to prioritise their own needs while fulfilling obligations to their families. And while the world is busy trying to ‘hack longevity’, Tara believes the focus must be on living well. As she puts it, Antara’s mission is 'to make the years that you are alive as joyful, as healthy, and as happy as possible'.]]></description>
      <pubDate><![CDATA[Fri, 2 Jan 2026 12:29:58 +0530]]></pubDate>
      <dc:creator>Shreya Chandra</dc:creator>
      <guid><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/access/watchlist/business/ageing-with-dignity-the-antara-senior-care-story-19812512.htm]]></guid>

      <title><![CDATA[Vikran Engineering targets ₹5,700 crore order book, sharpens focus on solar EPC and power projects]]></title>
      <link><![CDATA[https://www.cnbctv18.com/business/companies/vikran-engineering-targets-rs-5700-crore-order-book-sharpens-focus-on-solar-epc-power-projects-alpha-article-19805898.htm]]></link>
      <description><![CDATA[Vikran Engineering expects its unexecuted order book to reach up to ₹5,700 crore by the end of the year, led by solar EPC and power sector projects. CMD Rakesh Markhedkar said the company is focusing on integrated solar, BESS, and evacuation solutions, keeping water projects limited, and exploring overseas markets, while guiding for revenue of ₹1,400–₹1,600 crore and EBITDA margin of up to 17.5% for the year.]]></description>
      <pubDate><![CDATA[Mon, 29 Dec 2025 15:32:38 +0530]]></pubDate>
